uk.ac.cam.darknet.storage

Class ImageStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.darknet.storage.ImageStorage

  • public class ImageStorage
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores an image given as an URL, file or a awt.Image and returns its universally unique ID (UUID) which can be later used to obtain the photo from the storage. The images are stored in one folder with the unique ID being their name. The UUID is generated using java.util.UUID. For convenience, all images are stored as jpg files. The class is thread-safe.
    Author:
    Augustin Zidek

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ImageStorage()
      Creates a new image storage with default path of the storage being the folder storage/ on the same level as the folder bin/ is.
      ImageStorage(java.lang.String storagePath)
      Creates a new image storage located at the given path.

      Methods

      java.awt.Image retreiveImage(java.lang.String UUID)
      Retrieves an image with the given UUID from the storage
      java.lang.String saveImage(java.net.URL imageURL)
      Retrieves image from the given URL, generates a unique name for it, converts it into a jpg and saves it in the storage.

      • ImageStorage

        Creates a new image storage located at the given path.
        Parameters:
        storagePath - The path of the image storage folder.

      • ImageStorage

        public ImageStorage()
        Creates a new image storage with default path of the storage being the folder storage/ on the same level as the folder bin/ is.

    • Method Detail

      • saveImage

        public java.lang.String saveImage(java.net.URL imageURL)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves image from the given URL, generates a unique name for it, converts it into a jpg and saves it in the storage. The image can be retrieved from the storage using the retrieveImage() method.
        Parameters:
        imageURL - The URL where the image is.
        Returns:
        The unique identifier of the image
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the image can't be read from the URL or there was error saving it into the storage.

      • retreiveImage

        public java.awt.Image retreiveImage(java.lang.String UUID)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves an image with the given UUID from the storage
        Parameters:
        UUID - The UUID of the image
        Returns:
        The Image with such UUID, throws exception otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file with such UUID doesn't exist or there has been some other error while reading from the storage (i.e. the path of the storage might be corrupted).
